title: AI Startups in India Raise Record $2B in 2025

content:
Overview

2025 marked a watershed moment for Indian AI with over 200 startups raising significant funding. The total crossed $2 billion for the first time.

Key Players

Sarvam AI, Krutrim, and other homegrown LLM companies led the charge, with each raising over $100 million.

Key Trends

Enterprise AI, healthcare diagnostics, and vernacular AI models attracted the most investor interest in 2025.

Outlook

With AI becoming integral to business operations, experts predict the Indian AI market will reach $17 billion by 2027.
author: Vikram Singh

title: PhysicsWallah's EdTech Empire Expands Globally

content:
The Problem

Quality test preparation was expensive and accessible only to urban students. Tier-2 and Tier-3 students had limited options.

The Solution

PhysicsWallah offered high-quality education at a fraction of the cost, with courses priced at ₹2,000-3,000 compared to ₹50,000+ at competitors.

Founder Journey

Alakh Pandey started teaching on YouTube in 2014. His engaging teaching style and focus on concepts over rote learning built a massive following.

Global Expansion

The company is now entering international markets with localized content for IB and A-Levels curriculum.
author: Arjun Metha

title: IPO Ola Electric's IPO: What Investors Need to Know
excerpt: The ProblemIndia's dependence on fossil fuels for transportation was creating environmental and economic challenges. The country needed affordable, sustainable mobility solutions.The SolutionOla Elect
content:
The Problem

India's dependence on fossil fuels for transportation was creating environmental and economic challenges. The country needed affordable, sustainable mobility solutions.

The Solution

Ola Electric launched a range of affordable electric scooters with advanced features like regenerative braking, connected technology, and swappable batteries.

Founder Journey

Bhavish Aggarwal, already a successful entrepreneur with Ola Cabs, saw the future in electric mobility and spun off Ola Electric in 2017.

IPO Details

The IPO is expected to raise $700 million, making it one of the largest EV listings in Asia. Retail investors will get 35% allocation.
author: Rahul Verma
